_header: In Flanders whilom was a company
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Pardoner’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 506 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
IN fflaundres whilum was a companyeof yonge folke that haunted
                    folye…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…and as we dide lete vs laugh & pleyeanoon thei kissed
                    & riden forth here weye
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
the Pardoner (RT); Here endith the Pardonere his tale… (f.
                        249v)

BodBar20.First Lines:
In flaundres wilom was a companyeOf ȝong folke þat
                    haunted folie…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…And as we did lete vs lawhe and pleieAnon þei kussed and
                    riden forth her weie

Bod414.First Lines:
[I]N fflaundirs whilom was a cumpanyeOf yong fok that hauntid
                    folye…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…And as we did lat us laugh and pleyeAnd anon they kist and
                    ridde furth her wey

Bod686.First Lines:
In flaundres whilome was a compaignyeOf yonge folke þat
                    hauntedden folye…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…And as we deden lete vs lagh and pleyAnon they kiste and
                    riden forth hir wey
Bod686.Note:
VI.669 omitted; spurious line inserted at foot to follow
                    670.
Bod686.Attributed Title:
…And here begynneth his tale (f. 154v); Perdoner (RT);
                    Here endeth the Perdoners tale… (f. 161)

CULDd424.First Lines:
IN fflaundres whilom was a compaignyeOf ȝonge folk that
                    haunteden folye…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…And as we diden lat vs laughe and pleyeAnoon they kisten
                    & reden forth here weye

                    final third of the verso and following recto blank.

CULGg427.First Lines:
IN flaunderys whilhom dwellede a cumpanyeOf ȝonge folk that
                    hauntedyn folye…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…And as we ded lat vs laughe & pleyeAnon they kyste &
                    rede forth here weye

                    margin.

Here begynnyth the Pardounner his tale (f. 305, rubric); Here endith the
                    pardonneris tale (f. 311v)

CULIi326.First Lines:

                    riden forth her way

                    pardoner his tale… (f. 178v)

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:
[I]N fflaundres somtyme was a CompanyOf yong fok that haunted
                    folye…
CamFitzMc181.Last Lines:
…Nay nay quoth he than haue y cristes curseThe pepull at her
                    wordes lowhNo more of this for hit is right ynowhBut Iesu sende us
                    þat graceThat in heuen to haue oure euer dwellyng plase

BLHar1758.First Lines:

BLHar7333.First Lines:
IN flaunderis whilom was a companyOf yong folke that haunten
                    foly…
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
…So graunt yow his prdon to resseyveffor that is best I wolle
                    yow not disseyve
BLHar7333.Note:
VI.46, 622, 695, 869, 919-68 omitted; 679-80 reversed; spurious lines
                    follow 487, 620, 696, 870.
BLHar7333.Attributed Title: Here Endithe the Pardoner his tale… (f. 97rb)

BLHar7335.First Lines:
[I]N fflandres was whilom a compaignyeOf yonge folk that hauntedyn
                    folye…
BLHar7335.Last Lines:
…Ther cam a priue theef men clepen dethThat in this contre al
                    the peple sleth…
BLHar7335.Note:
VI.565-77, 595-610, everything after 676 lost; 560-4, 588-91 partially
                    lost. Catchphrase ‘And with his spere’ at the foot of f.
                        163v.
BLHar7335.Attributed Title:
ffirst he repreuyth the vice of glotonye (f. 160v, placed as
                    heading to the Tale)

BLLan851.First Lines:
Bot þan spak oure Hoste vnto Maister schipman Maister quod he
                    to us summe tale tel ȝe can Where withe ȝe myht glad al þis
                    company If it were ȝoure pleseinge I wote wele sekurlye Sertes
                    quod þis Schipman a tale I can tell And þerfore herkeneþ
                    hyderward how þat I wil spell In flaundres whilom was a
                    compaignieOf ȝonge folke þat hawten folye…
BLLan851.Last Lines:
…And as we dide now late vs lauhe & pleieAnone þei
                    kisse and reden forþe þeire weye
BLLan851.Note:
Introduced by a spurious 6-line link. VI.466, 603-4, 622, 646 omitted;
                    679-80 reversed; spurious lines follow 487, 488, 620.
BLLan851.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Lansdowne Manuscript of Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales.
Chaucer Society
         Series 1, nos. 7, 13, 20, 36, 43, 55, 69. London: Trübner,
            1868-79.

BNangl39.First Lines:
In flaundres whilom was a compaignyof yong folk that hauntid
                    foly…
BNangl39.Last Lines:
…and as we did let vs laugh and playanon thei kissid and ridyn
                    forth her way
BNangl39.Attributed Title:
…& subsequenter / incipit fabula perdonarij sic (f.
                        65ra); Explicit fabula perdonarij… (f.
                        67vb)
